alert.note: Alert for Absaroka, Beartooth Mountains; Beartooth Foothills; Crazy Mountains; Golden Valley; Livingston Area; Melville Foothills; Northern Park; Northern Stillwater; Northern Sweet Grass; Paradise Valley; Southern Wheatland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 3:33PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...AN AREA OF SNOW, BLOWING SNOW, AND POOR VISIBILITY... An area of light to moderate snow has developed along I-90 from west of Billings to Livingston, and north to the Musselshell river valley. This snow combined with winds gusting 30 to 45 mph is creating areas of poor visibility and blowing snow. Snow accumulations will be generally an inch or less. But the poor visibility, slick snow covered roads, and gusty winds, will make travel difficult through 6 PM MST. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Columbus, Big Timber, Harlowton, Clyde Park, Ryegate, Deadmans Basin Reservoir, Absarokee, Lavina, Springdale, Franklin, Reed Point, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Shawmut, Twodot, Hailstone Wildlife Refuge, Molt, Mc Leod, Melville and Park City. Visibilities may drop below 1 mile at times. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
